channel.title: CBC Radio 3 Podcast
channel.description: CBC Radio 3 is the part of Canada's public broadcaster that devotes itself entirely to new Canadian music. With the CBC Radio 3 Super Feed, you can catch every podcast we make and loads of amazing new tunes in just one place.
channel.itunes:subtitle: 100% Independent Canadian Music
channel.itunes:summary: CBC Radio 3 is the part of Canada's public broadcaster that devotes itself entirely to new Canadian music. With the CBC Radio 3 Super Feed, you can catch every podcast we make and loads of amazing new tunes in just one place.
channel.itunes:author: CBC Radio 3

item.title: Highlights from Halifax Pop Explosion: Little Girls, Japandroids & Zeus
item.description: Japandroids, Zeus and Little Girls stormed Halifax Pop Explosion and we’ve got some of the greatest moments on this week’s sessions podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: Japandroids, Zeus and Little Girls stormed Halifax Pop Explosion and we’ve got some of the greatest moments on this week’s sessions podcast
item.itunes:summary: Japandroids, Zeus and Little Girls stormed Halifax Pop Explosion and we’ve got some of the greatest moments on this week’s sessions podcast

item.title: Pathological Lovers - Storm Your Little
item.description: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Craig Norris: "In Tom Power's words: They're exploding in Newfoundland. Now, let's make it so elsewhere."
item.itunes:subtitle: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Craig Norris: "In Tom Power's words: They're exploding in Newfoundland. Now, let's make it so elsewhere."
item.itunes:summary: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Craig Norris: "In Tom Power's words: They're exploding in Newfoundland. Now, let's make it so elsewhere."

item.title: Treelines - Canadian Airlines
item.description: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Amanda Putz: "It says more about this country in a mere 3 minutes than a 3 hour throne speech ever could."
item.itunes:subtitle: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Amanda Putz: "It says more about this country in a mere 3 minutes than a 3 hour throne speech ever could."
item.itunes:summary: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Amanda Putz: "It says more about this country in a mere 3 minutes than a 3 hour throne speech ever could."

item.title: The Sunshine Show 29
item.description: This week, Mr. Johnson attempts to make amends for last weeks 'transgressions' and reads another entry into his Short Story Competition. 9 songs are also played.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Mr. Johnson attempts to make amends for last weeks 'transgressions' and reads another entry into his Short Story Competition. 9 songs are also played.
item.itunes:summary: This week, Mr. Johnson attempts to make amends for last weeks 'transgressions' and reads another entry into his Short Story Competition. 9 songs are also played.

item.title: Julie Fader - Goodbye Before Hello
item.description: New Music Canada Track of the Day. Guest Host, Brian Borcherdt from Holy F*ck: "I can request this one because I didn't produce it but a good friend of mine did..."

item.title: R3-30: Chart 173
item.description: The R3-30 3.0, or "The Chart of the Future" debuts, featuring Woodhands, We Are Wolves, the most "Searched For" and "Fanned" artist on cbcradio3.com and a Fun Club Pick of the Week.

item.title: #231 - Best Songs of the 2000s Part One
item.description: Need proof that the 2000s were Canada’s best music decade ever? Listen to this podcast, part one of Grant Lawrence’s Top 20 countdown of his favourite songs of the decade.
item.itunes:subtitle: Need proof that the 2000s were Canada’s best music decade ever? Listen to this podcast, part one of Grant Lawrence’s Top 20 countdown of his favourite songs of the decade.
item.itunes:summary: Need proof that the 2000s were Canada’s best music decade ever? Listen to this podcast, part one of Grant Lawrence’s Top 20 countdown of his favourite songs of the decade.

item.title: Cuff the Duke in Session

item.title: EP #2 - Has Technology Made Music Better?
item.description: On the second episode of Extended Play host Lisa Christiansen asks the question: has technology made music better? Featuring interviews with Buffy Sainte-Marie, The Russian Futurists and an educator and student of technology.

item.title: The Sunshine Show 28
item.description: This week. Mr. Johnson presents his New Year's Spectacular, with special guests Lyle Waggoner, Barbara Eden and Jim Boyd, featuring a musical tribute to Hoagy Carmichael.

item.title: Special Edition - The Artist Series featuring Lightning Dust
item.description: The Artist Series with Amber Webber and Josh Wells from Lightning Dust. The Vancouver duo shares a playlist of side projects born from Canadian indie bands, as well as music from their roommates past and present.

item.description: This week, Mr. Johnson makes the ultimate sacrifice and as in studio on Christmas Day. He attempts to celebrate the holiday with his family, despite the distance. And there are songs.

item.title: R3-30: The Best of R3 30 Questions

item.title: #230 - Winter Songs Podcast
item.description: Celebrating Canada's longest and darkest season with songs of understanding and endurance by Matt Mays, Hawksley Workman, the Weakerthans, Julie Doiron and many more. Brrrrrrrrrrrrr.

item.title: Is it still possible to write a Christmas classic - Episode 1
item.description: Welcome to the first edition of CBC Radio 3’s new current affairs podcast. This week we embrace the holidays and ask the question: is it still possible to write a Christmas classic? Featuring Ron Sexsmith, Zeus, Craig Norris and Rita MacNeil.
